data.title: Kings & Queens of Aragon
data.meta_description: A list of the three rulers of the kingdom of Aragon, the dates of their reign and their spouses: Ferdinand II, Juana I and Charles I (known as Charles V)
data.text:
There were three rulers of the kingdom of Aragon during the period corresponding with the reign of the Tudors up until 1556, when Philip II, on death of his father Charles V, became King of a united Spain.

Monarch Dates of Reign Spouse(s) Ferdinand II 20 January 1479 - 23 January 1516 Isabella, Queen of Castile

Germaine de Foix

Juana I

(co-ruler with her son,

who ruled in fact)

23 January 1516 - 12 April 1555 Philip von Hapsburg, Duke of Burgundy Charles I

(known as Charles V,

from his title as

Holy Roman Emperor

23 January 1516 - 16 January 1556 Isabella of Portugal
